text: Chipotle is my favorite place to eat but the past 2 times I've went they were out of the barbacoa.
I used to eat here twice a week until this last time I got so sick and the only thing I ate all day was chipotle. Disgusting. Never coming back.

I'm surprised by the average 3 star review that this place currently has. My wife and I eat here all of the time because it's close to where we live and the food is always good, and the employees are always friendly. Don't be fooled by the average 3 star review, it's a great place to have lunch or dinner.

Chipotle really has gone down in quality.  I always order the same thing.  Chicken and Steak in a burrito.  It is only meats and for years has been my favorite food.  Lately the chicken and steak are bone dry and lack the flavor it used to have.  The steak used to be nice and tender but now is rubbery and half-assed.

It really is a shame as I used to order this 3 times a week.  I really wish management would bring the quality back.

This restaurant is clean.  The service is good and staff is friendly.  If only they served Mexican food.  Failing that, would it hurt them to serve a burger or some alternative to whatever that stuff is they sell?

You can't go wrong at chipotles!!! It has something for everyone from burritos to bowls to salad to  margaritas.  

 This location is support convenient Right across the street from work.  It's super fast service.  Food is always omg fresh!   It is for real an orgasm  in your mouth that you crave over and over again! !!!
Food here is always good. They give you large portions. Customer service is good. I always go to this location since it's the closest to my work.

I ordered a steak burrito and a steak bowl and the portions where way off from my expectations it made me feel like I ordered a kids meal or something. I asked the lady to fill it up a bit more because the plate looked empty and the burrito looked flat. She added a very small portion and charged me for the extra meat when there wasn't even any meat in in the first place. This visit was totally not my money's worth how disappointing

The food is good, but the service sucks. The girls that serve the food would choose what amount of food you would get depending on your race. If you look Mexican you would get the less amount which is funny since is "Mexican restaurant". It had happen more than once, and I had talk to the manager but still nothing as been done. My advice is that if you are planning to go eat there, make sure you wear a costume maybe then you would be treated the same.

This is the best Mexican food ever! I eat it at least once a week.

Love the barbacoa bowl & tacos!!! Everything is delicious especially the guacamole with the lemony & salty tortilla chips. Very very very good!!!

Love this place. I love that they put some bacon in the pinto beans. At first it grossed me out because I don't eat pork but wow, best pinto beans around. I usually get a high protein and veggie bowl for an on the go meal or when I feel like being bad. Been coming here for years. Will continue. 4 stars and not 5 because its the only Mexican restaurant that doesn't include chips!! They charge like 2-3 bucks which is kind of a rip off.  Otherwise very fair pricing.
Hold back on amount of food they give you and have to continuous ask for more after get small half scoops of item. Food is very ok.

Was looking forward to grabbing a healthy meal here after hearing about it from many people. Got a big sack of beans and rice with some chicken in my burrito. Was tough to eat it cleanly, it just kind of fell apart. Flavor was okay but not very special at all. For the price I think the value is too low for decent Mexican food. The staff at this location was very friendly and helpful so that is good.
I can find no good reason to go back to Chipotle again.

When I came here the other day, it was as If all the employees were stoned.  Haha. Seriously. They were out of chicken, steak and salsa. There were no small drink cups ready. There were no clean trays ready for in-store dining. The cashier forgot to ring me up for a drink (because there were no cups). She forgot to grab a bag of chips I had paid for. She asked me 3 times which beer I wanted. 3 times, apologizing saying she forgot. 

Yikes. There was only 2 people in front of me and my friend and it took us (not exaggerating) 18 minutes to get through the line and to the table.

As always - very inconsistent. 

However ...

friendly staff - and food is usually very good.

Never busy.

I'm rating the service, not the food here. Quality of food here is as expected and tastes like every other Chipotle. My co-workers and I had to eat a quick dinner and so we went as a group of 8 people and paid with the company card, so the cashier had to wait for all 8 bowls to be finished until she could check us out. For some reason she was really annoyed that we bought 8 bowls, 5 bags of chips, and fountain drinks. She didn't even say thank you after we paid. We bought some Coronas too and they didn't have the common sense to give us lime with them. WE HAD TO ASK FOR LIME FOR CORONAS. WTF IS THAT?! I had also asked and paid for a side of guacamole, and my group took the rest of food to the table and I stood there waiting for my guac for a couple minutes, she then looked at me with that same annoyed look and asked what I needed. You guys need better managers and attitude training.

This is one of my favorite places for lunch or dinner.  Every time I visit Las Vegas I make a stop here for the burrito.  I usually order the steak burrito with brown rice, veggies, black beans, cheese, lettuce, and salsa.  Service is fast as they make your order like a cafeteria style.  This location is not that busy so there usually isn't a line and there is a lot of free parking.  Come hungry because the burritos are huge.

I initially created a yelp account to give this location a bad review because I had issues with how the food and sauces tasted, but because of the manager's friendliness and exceptional customer service I decided to change my mind. I'm a happy customer thanks to him he went above and beyond to make sure all of my issues were taken care of.
The food tastes good but for $6.10 you'd think they'd give you more than half a spoon of rice and half a spoon of beans. It's just rice and beans, people.

Hey Chipotle on Sahara and Decatur, the Dead Sea called. They want their salt back.  This has to be one of the saltiest meals I've ever had. I had a chicken burrito bowl and I could tell it was both the chicken and the fajitas that had all the sodium. I could have squeezed out all the salt, made my own float tank, and traveled to the Upside Down. I'm as dehydrated as a piece of beef jerkey. I'm as salty as Hillary Clinton was on November 8th. Sorry Hillary. In all seriousness I'll probably give it one more shot since it's the closest Chipotle to my work but that'll be it if it's still salty.

This is got to be the worst Chipotle location I have ever eaten at.. i get it, prices go up or the portion sizes continue to get Less but this is ridiculous! I Pay almost $9 for a burrito and get a pinch of Barbacoa?  A big chain like this still messed  this up??  They should have a weight scale there that can measure the appropriate portions. Kind of a no brainier.  The previous time was barely acceptable but this is just too much sorry Chipotle. If I wanted a bean rice and cheese burrito I could go to El Pollo Loco and get it for  $2.  Needless to say you've lost my business.

I recently went to grab some lunch and it was a tremendous experience that I'll never forget. The lines were long , too long. People were getting Mad and there were no more.seats. I had to literally eat my food in the car. Maybe that day made it disappointing for me. I'll try to check if there busy before I ever walk in again.

Reason I gave this location only 2 stars is because the staff behind the counter are in such a rush it almost appears that they are on some type of substance. Asked the girl preparing my bowl for black instead of pinto beans and she stared at me for a few seconds in irritation because I changed my choice of beans. Next girl was asking me what I wanted in my bowl while she was preparing a different item for another customer. Its like she wasnt listening and then of course had to repeat myself to her. Staff is very robotic, even the cashier. What an awful experience when one is just trying to enjoy a break from a long day. Food was good. Staff customer service needs to be reassessed by management.
Small portions. Was disappointed i had to buy two burritos and i wasnt even full. Like they really cheap put on the rice and beans and even more so on the meat. Wont come to this location again

Chipotle is my go-to for a low-cal lunch during the workday (a chicken salad with no cheese or dressing, but plenty of salsa, for anyone curious). I order online and head straight to the register when I arrive. Aside from being convenient, this allows me to avoid the giant line that forms every day around noon. 

The food is standard Chipotle, which I happen to like a lot. The restaurant is clean and pleasant, albeit noisy. The parking lot seems to be modeled after parking lots in the 7th circle of hell.

The only gripe I have is that my online order is rarely ready when I arrive. Unless I'm 10+ minutes late, I often have to wait for my food to be prepared. But, since the online orders are put together in the back, it's still much faster than waiting in line.

This chipotle was awful. Just awful. Me and my boyfriend came in around 7 and it was dead super dead and it took so long for them to make the food and all their meats looked dry and old like it was made hours before. And when we looked for a place to sit. We had to go outside because there were no clean tables.

I came to the Las Vegas ASD Trade show and stopped by this Chipotle location at the fashion show mall around 8pm on 8/02/15 to get a "healthy meal" before I went to bed early. I ordered a burrito bowl and about 4-5 hours later I got severe food poisoning. I was throwing up all night and ended up having to go to the emergency room. The doctor at the urgent care assured me it was food poisoning. Because of your food, I ended up missing the first day of the trade show that I have been prepping for, for almost 2 months and spent thousands of dollars setting up. That is NOT ACCEPTABLE, and I can't even calculate how much potential business I lost. The next three days of the show I was also feeling very sick but forced myself to get up and get to work while being extremely sick. 

After going to the chipotle website and speaking with Jessica, all she had to say was "well I have good news, it wasn't chipotle according to my investigation"... I think maybe she feels that a doctor who went to school for 10 years is wrong. The only thing I had to eat that day was chipotle besides my normal protein shakes that I always have. And the only thing I was throwing up was chipotle, then after I threw up the chipotle, every time I drank water I was throwing that up too. I would like to say that I have never in my life had food poisoning until this incident, and I have not been sick for the past 6 years of my life. My medical history will prove that. I believe I have a pretty strong immune system as I stay healthy and workout regularly.

I'm completely appalled by not only the restaurants food, but also the customer service provided by Jessica. She had told me she would continue her investigation and get back to me, but I haven't heard back from her since.

Sad customer service with tiny portions. Their stock price might be at an all time high but, from my viewpoint, the friendliness & quality at this location is at an all time low.

3/12/17
New staff is so much nicer! Bigger portions today, as well. ;) 3.5 star for much needed improvements.

I eat 3-4 times a week at Chipotle, so not new to Chipotle. But at this location, the staff are very inconsistent with the quantity of meat/chicken, I have had times when i barely got 2-3 oz of meat in my bowl/burrito. Went there today and i had half a spoon of chicken in my bowl. If only they would not be so stingy about meat/chicken, i would have no complaints about this place. Please get your staff to read the quantity to be served from the Chipotle website and help them understand it (if they can).

For now, might just skip this location and go to the one on Maryland.

I'm not a big fan of this style cuisine, but I've always heard this is the Mexican subway. I love subway so I figured I'd give this a try. It can be a bit pricey, however I always get a burrito and they feel it so full that they can barely wrap it in the tin foil and everything is always so delicious and fresh. I only took a star off because I ordered an alcoholic beverage once and it was about $8 and came in a much tinier glass than I expected. That has been my only complaint.

One of the first things on my greedy mind when I visit the mainland is Chipotle. We were jetlagged and in a frenzy when we walked in. The food is always good, but the staff at this location was superb! We kept changing, rearranging, and adding to our order. I felt bad for them, but the cashier was so accommodating and gave excellent customer service! I wanna say her name is Stephanie, but I could be wrong.

This was my first time trying Chipotle so I was pretty excited! My coworker Brittenee and I come in around 6:45 PM today (12/10/2016) on our lunch break. We saw that the previous people who got bowls had like a mountain of food so I got even more excited to see huge portions! When it was our turn, we both got bowls. They have brown rice and white rice, we both ordered white rice. There wasn't even enough to cover the bottom layer while the people before got a lot of rice. If they ran out, we would've been okay with waiting but they didn't bother asking. Fine whatever. She got chicken and I got steak. The portion of steak was pretty good for the amount of rice we got! 

Moving down the line, my coworker got extra sour cream and cheese on her bowl. The girl doing it was making faces and mocking her. After that I can hear her whispering rude things about us to the cashier at the end while the cashier was laughing. That's so disrespectful. I'm sorry you make less than $10 an hour and you're miserable at your work, but feel free to quit so someone who would appreciate it could take over. I'm sure my little 15 year old sister would do a much better job than she did. I had no problem calling the manager Jesus after. He was extremely kind and apologetic. Hopefully he rethinks his staff and hires people who deserve the money and experience. 

Now for the food, it was really good! The portion was smaller than everyone elses we saw and smaller than all the pictures, but it's still filling! The flavors are great and I really recommend it. The corn salsa is a little spicy but it added the perfect amount of heat to it and also added a great crunch element to it. To get avocado on it, it is an additional $1.25 so keep that in mind! The location was clean. They have beer and a soda fountain. Who doesn't like a good beer with food? The food for two bowls (without drinks, chips, or anything else) was about $17.00. 

I'd definitely get the bowl again, just not from this location. Great food, poor service.

From 4/25/15
Typical Chipotle, with the same service as any of the other stores.  I got the steak tacos they were delish. The food is good, same quality as any other Chipotle, and they are a clean location.
.
Super nice and helpful. Delicious too. Standard chipotle, nothing special compared to the others, except the workers tend to be a little nicer. But chipotle in general is delicious so 4 stars.

Great food, very fresh, fast line during lunch time rush. Employees shouldn't forget that some people haven't been there before or haven't been there for awhile so ordering doesn't come natural, help us out. Maybe you could say "Have you been here before?" and if not explain a few things, or otherwise if they say the have been there say "Welcome back!" ...just a thought  :) Great, quick, satisfying meal. I ordered the bowl with brown rice, steak, pico de gallo, cheese, guacamole, black beans - fresh iced tea YUM

It's the same as all the other Chipotle locations. The food is good, prices are reasonable (no Vegas upcharge!), and plenty of seating. Too bad it's a bit of a drive from the Strip, but it's nicely situated to let you get a breather from the craziness of the Vegas Strip.

I like Chipotle this one is a decent location, the staff is friendly enough and the food is usually is pretty fresh due to the high traffic at this location. Beware on Fridays it get really busy around lunch so come after 1PM to make sure you have a spot to sit. The cleanliness is my main concern here the need to do a better job in the dining area and in the restroom of maintaining the standards.

This is my son's all time fav!! I got the carnitas burrito. Although I'm sooo to the tacqueria burritos from the "la mission" district in the Bay Area, ok this will do for now. I've been to chipotle in Elk Grove, CA, I guess I'm spoiled & just a Cali girl@heart! LOL Place wasn't as packed & busy, that's a good thing. So for the place & location, I couldn't ask for more & just am grateful for finding this place on route home. Thank u smooches
I've always gotten great service at this location. It can be quite busy during lunch hours but still never a long wait.

Haven't stepped foot into this chain since the food poisoning viral outbreaks across the country.  But here I am sticking my big toe back into the pool. The food was ok. The service was lack luster. The cashier was rude about giving me fresh chips that I watched another young lady making in the back. She was making a couple of batches, salting them down and adding fresh lime. The fresh lime was pretty impressive so I wanted a hot batch.  In the past, I've had the very cold and very stale chips sitting on the shelf behind the cashier station. The foot is generally good, but chips have always left a lot to be desired at Chipotle. So, I was excited to see them actually making some chips right in front of me!! Anyway, the girl was rude and argumentative.I insisted on hot chips and finally got them. It was also very interesting that her Manager was actually in line behind me. He later came to our table and apologized for her behavior. It was ok because I wasn't ever planning to go back. There are way too many other choices, and Chipotle has enough bad press for them to tolerate this behavior on any level. Their brand has gone to hell as far as I'm concerned. This location is not making their case any better. Food was ok. Servers on the line need more training. Cashier needs to be terminated. No thanks.

Chipotle is awesome I'm really glad I haven't experienced any of the crazy stuff that has been in the news about them. I love that at almost every location I've visited they have offered some of the best customer service! Fast and efficient combined with a great lunch break meal is what I need to make a great day!

QUICKY QUICKY!

I remember when I first tried chipotle & saw the size of the burrito... I refused to let the size scare me & chowed down 2 to prove everyone it ain't a thing. 

Till this day 10 years later I can still chow down 2 burritos! Its just like eating 2 bowls of rice.. hahaha 

The staff was super nice & freaken QUICK!!  In & out if there in less than 10 minutes. 

My only thing was that the amount of protein they gave was little compared to other locations I been too... most places give you a big whole scoop & a little more... but this place literally was like a quick scoop kinda action... so I ordered double meat... & it looked like the amount I would get everywhere else =\ 

My fajita steak burrito w/ guacamole was like $13 something... I was still hungry after... =[ o well

I'm here right now at 4 p.m. on June 14th. Really blown away how nice and attentive the staff is!  They just had a rush and I got the last of the peppers when I had asked for extra. I opted not to wait for the fresh ones and went to sit down and eat, and they brought me some fresh to my table any way! Thanks ladies, you made my day

Service here is not that great. Employees are not happy and the food station is a mess. Never coming back here.  I'll be going to the Chipotle on Tropicana and Fort Apache from now on. They're doing it right.

Why is this pace such a mess? They need to clean this place up.

Came in wanting tacos and a burrito to go, instead just got my tacos. Out of steak at 7:30 and  they weren't going to replenish it? Um, what's going on? And then apparently it's too hard to work on two things at the same time. I ordered both a burrito and tacos from the kid behind the counter, then he started scooping the meat onto the tortillas. He then had the flour tortilla out and scooped out some  white rice. The young lady next to him asks me for my choice of toppings. When done I look over so she can start on my burrito and the tortilla with the rice was no longer there! Yeah, forget it, I'm not going to spend my money on bad and incompetent service. There are too many restaurant options in Vegas to deal with bad food or service. My tacos, shredded beef and chicken were just alright. Chicken was dry.

I visited this joint again today, and i went there in lunch hours. this is by far the worst experience i had.
Service was okay, i mean its just fast food so i didnt really expect getting any service. As usual i ordered a half and half burrito bowl, and i barely got any rice & meat. its not even 1/3 of the portion size that i used to get in orange county!!
From what i saw, nearly everyone paid for the extra meat.

Is this the new chipotle policy or it just happens to this place?

I think i will just go to the other chipotles in town.

For a good price and decent food, I like Chipotle, but I was not happy with the service I received.  I do not eat meat so I need my veggies and I would like a good amount of them for $8, not just a small scoop.  But first, my experience at this location was terrible.  I got there, ordered my veggie salad and there was less then half a cup of veggies left in the dish, of course they probably have been sitting there for sometime and not fresh.  The lady behind the counter asked me if it was okay just to put those on, OF COURSE NOT!  I am not here paying for old veggies, I want fresh.  So I had to wait about 10 minutes for fresh veggies to be prepared.  Then, they only put on a small scoop, umm, mam, I am only getting veggies and lettuce, please put more on.  And of course when I asked for this I was given a "I am super annoyed look" by the employee.  HOW RUDE!  After I finally got my salad, it tasted good, nothing too special, but it was good.  Customer service sucked and I  will not go back to that location!

Every time Ive come in this location employees are much less enthusiastic. That said I avoid this one when possible but today I had a craving after not having had it for a long while. I figured the retraining chipotle closed for yesterday would have made for some improvements. To her credit the girl greeted with a smile but I didn't make it past the beans. Ordered a burrito with black beans and to my dismay there was chicken and residue in them. I pointed it out and she offered to make new beans. Now call me picky but after all the fuss lately I decided that might be a good idea and keeps them vegetarian friendly. She said it'll be awhile and I said okay and stood there, awkwardly. She didn't suggest how long and that I might have a seat nor offer me a drink or chips while I wait. Neither did the manager who was sitting at a table towards the door think to chime in. Apparently the stove wasn't even on so I assume they still have to heat it, prep the beans and cook them. Made me wonder when all the previous food out was made if the grills weren't even hot. I sat down and after a few minutes the beans weren't out the back yet so I got up and left as the hangry set in. So to sum it up I feel they could be more careful with there food and more thoughtful when a problem arise especially since I was the only one at all in line. Maybe I'll try a chipotle again in a couple months.
i LOVE chipotle! very fast service especially during the lunch rush and its close to my workplace. =)
You either love or hate Chipotle. Me personally I LOVE CHIPOTLE. The burrito bowl is my all time favorite.
I get suckered to go here, never my choice but I like the food its okay but for some reason it always ends up making my tummy hurt.

I love this place! I really do wish other restaurants would step up and serve food with great ingredients. I think this restaurant chain is amazing. They have broken through the barriers of synthetic food. Congratulations chipotle!!!
The world needs more restaurants like you.

1. Food is great and fresh
2. Customer Service was horrendous
(I asked for extra sour cream and cheese and was told "Wow! More I'm surprised your not constipated" very rude)
3. Facility was clean and neat

Purely for portion size.  I'm always left a little hungry here compared to the other chipotole's.  I specifically eat here during lunch hours and the other one off the 215/Rainbow more often during dinner hours. 

At the 215/Rainbow location, last two times I couldn't even finish my burrito bowl, while here I'm left a little hungry...   Consistently 25-50% smaller portions. 

Management must be trying to minimize expenses at our expense. Otherwise, staff is friendly and such.

This used to be an Uno's years ago- in the 1990's. (Yup, used to eat there with my husband, back when, we were just good friends.)  Since then, it's been numerous other restaurants, with little or no success. 

All the restaurants are pretty much the same decor- a little similar to Hash  House A Go Go- metal elements/industrial central to their restaurants. This one seems bigger/spacious than the one near the University, because it is long- shaped like a rectangle, rather than a square. No drive-thru window. There were three other patrons (more empty than the one near the University which is hoppin') and four people working there. Though there are other Fast-Mex restaurants in the area (El Pollo Loco and Baja Fresh- each one has different favorites), I hope that this one finds success at this historically unlucky location. 

Finally went here over the weekend for takeout. I bought a chicken burrito and a chicken salad for a little over $12 (regular price). I love how all the meat is naturally raised ("Food with Integrity" is part of their mission statement), at these restaurants. I also love that it is made right there in front of you (kinda like Zaba's & Q-Doba). This way, one can customize. I had the chicken (perfectly seasoned), crisp romaine greens, corn, pico de gallo, peppers and onions, and cheese- comes with chipotle-honey vinaigrette. It's so good, but doesn't need much dressing since I also had the pico- but thinking I might just get the peppers and onions because I noticed my super-oniony  (from the raw onions in the pico de gallo) taste in my mouth afterward. Most of the greens were fresh, just had one leaf that was not good. You can get beans, but I skipped them this time. My husband's stuffed chicken burrito had the white rice (no cilantro), pinto beans, cheese, and sour cream. It took him a couple attempts to finish it. I told my husband we should come here more often. This one's more convenient to us since it's just one street away.   

Adult menu is basically three prices- $5.50- vegetarian, $5.85- chicken, $6.10- carnitas, barbacoa, & steak. Select Burrito, Burrito Bowl, Tacos (3), or Salad. Four different salsas to suit everyone's taste- from mild to hot. Extras & Drinks: chips, salsa, guacamole- $1.50-$2.25, Alcohol: beer and margaritas- $2.75-$3.50, Bottled drinks, & Soda (free refills). Kids menu $2.95-$3.95 quesadillas/taco/taco kit. You can order online www.chipotle.com, iPhone App, or by fax- since the menu is the same one used everywhere, no individual location's information is listed, sorry. 

Simple menu, made your way, great food, yummy choices, fast, fresh, quality ingredients, inexpensive, clean- this is a no-brainer for us.

Food is good and so is the customer service. You really can't go wrong with a simple menu. The meat could have a little more flavor and would go a long way if the tortillas were freshly made. The location is hard to get to depending on if you're coming from Sahara or Decatur. Definitely good enough for lunch!

Hella thick and juicy!

Now Chipotle, all are the same? NO!

Here the cashiers are pretty awesome, my chica stuffed the shit outta my burrito with chicken, rice, beans, hot salsa, crema, cheese, and some lettuce! THIS THING WAS SOOO BIG IT RIPPED DOWN THE MIDDLE! Now at first I was a little pissed, but then I was like "Yea!!" I basically ate half the burrito with chips, then took the rest home for dinner!

Place itself is not super super busy so its nice, and its always clean! Prices have risen a little and the menu is nice bc it tells you calorie info.

In addition they have tacos, bowls, and quesadillas. Go get your eat on babies!

I'm pretty picky when it comes to my food. I always get either the bowl or the burrito with plain white rice and just a tiny bit of it. So many times I get attitude from the employees or they try and put like a cup of rice which I'm sorry is just way too much. 

This was my first visit to this location and the lady who started my food was friendly and understood the meaning of "a tiny bit of rice" mainly because it's a burrito don't need rice in it and without it the beans soak a hole in the tortilla. I absolutely hate cilantro LOL and yea my boyfriend is Hispanic haha but yea back to the restaurant... The lady was also the cashier so she had to walk off and let the second line worker finish our food. She also understands the importance of good portions. So many times I get like a pinch of cheese like really?! But not her she put a perfect amount of cheese and sourcream on the first try! Steak was brown all the way through so it definitely was a little old which works great for me because I can't eat medium rare meat which is how they cook it. 

All in all great visit will definitely return!

This place just opened up in the Bermuda Triangle that is Sahara Pavilion(sahara/decatur)

Grand Opening is May 8th in the old Spirit of Cuba location. 

Today they had a fundraiser to benefit Caring 4 Kids Foundation from 5-8 pm. $5 donation you can get ANY & Everything you want off the menu & a drink!

My son & I each got a burrito & chips/salsa-we got a barbacoa & chicken. They were huge with rice & choice of beans plus pico,guac & more. The meats were fantastic-real spicy.

The service was outstanding , the place was clean & inviting with music pumped in.

There are about 10 4 person tables and a few 2 person tables. Probably under 40 people seating indoors, but they have outdoor patio seating too.

The only missing is a salsa bar.

I'd rather go here anytime over Roberto's & Baja Fresh in this neighborhood.

Guy didnt wrap the burrito right. I felt like the girl on the line shoulda trained him instead of telling him to hurry. Giving 4 stars because the cashier with the tattoos was super nice and compensated me

Always a good place to eat during lunch time. It's a busy place also. Got my usual steak bowl. Never different, always the same. Lol. But I'm not getting sick of it. Anyways friendly service loud music and good vibe to relax and chill.
Sometimes the steak is rare.  Actually a lot of times the steak is rare.  I like mine more medium.  Overall the burrito or burrito bowl hit their mark.  Love the guac.

Service was awful, line was slow and really out of order. Ordered a
Chicken Burrito, pretty blah if you ask me. Medium hot sauce was awful! Like sludge!!! Couldn't even eat it, plus it wasn't spicy at all it was sour?!! I'll never return to this location.

I've discovered that I am obsessed with Sofritas!  For those of you that aren't familiar with it, it is an alternative to meat that Chipotle offers. Sofritas is made of tofu. I know what you're thinking, Tofu???  The consistency is really like ground beef and with the flavoring you would think it is. 
I was uncertain about It when I first tried it but soon discovered that I love it. 

I visit this location for lunch. Though it can become quite the popular spot, the line always moves quickly. There are plenty of tables to sit at including tables on the outdoor patio. 

Food never disappoints. Everything is fresh and full of flavor. I get a side of cilantro to add as an extra and there is Chipotle Tabasco in the dining area.

This has to be one of the busiest Chipotles in the whole world! Unless you have 20+ minutes to wait, avoid this palce during the lunch rush. It is usually safe to visit after 2pm. 

The staff is very friendly/quick and the food is always fresh.

I came in recently for a Halloween special that was going on. 

I got a chicken burrito with black beans, brown rice, peppers and onions, sour cream, and cheese.

For so much going on in the burrito, I was able taste each component. The chicken had good flavor and wasn't dry or tough, the black beans weren't mushy, the brown rice was fluffy, the 
pepper and onions still had a nice crisp with a good sauted flavor, and the sour scream and cheese added a binding creamyness to everything.  Everything came together as a filling and tasty burrito.

I got some guacamole and salsa on the side to keep my burrito from getting soggy. I just ended up eating them separately as dips with some chips. They ended being a unexpected and good side dish.

I haven't been to a Chipotle in awhile, and after this visit I am inclined to return more often.
Chipotle is so mediocre and unsatisfying but I still eat here a few times a year if I need something fast and somewhat healthy.
The most horrendous service ever! Change your attitude maybe you will get a tip or more customers. Very rude and impatient I had to repeat over and over.
Very busy. Line is moving fast tho. I got a chicken bowl was tasty.   I'd go here again

I ordered a quesadilla here and the girl rang up $20 when I gave her a $10 so, she was a bit frazzled...she must have been new cuz it happened to the customer before me too...the service here is ok but, it's like fast food so what do you expect?
I always go to this place when I feel fat :) so salad day today again !!!!

I love chipotle. The food is fresh and the guacamole is amazing. However I cant stand the fact that they are so stingy with the serving size. I mean if im paying 7$ for chicken there better be a good amount of chicken on there.

Staffs in this location need to be retrained or layoff. Terrible customer service, no smile like you owe them money, the portion they give is very very stingy. Never had any bad experience in SW/rainbow location where I used to live but now this is the closest one, every time I step in to this location I lost my appetite.

I stop by here a few times every couple of months and have always liked the food and the portions are good sized for the price.  I started going once they added the vegan tofu "meat".  It is actually really, really good!  I have never had a complaint about service or anything and decided to do a review after my last visit on Wednesday night 12/14/16 because they were just exceptionally pleasant as they were taking our order.  Nothing specific to point out, they just had a great and happy energy about them.  They even gave me a small bowl of rice for our grandson and oohed and awwwed over him. I will keep them on my route for quick good food when am doing errands or going to thrift stores.

Disgusted by the lack of customer service and the disrespectful attitude of a staff member who was working the register by the name of Briana. I asked to speak to a manager she smiled and said I am the manager. I then  asked Briana for a card she tapped the top of the register and told me to take one. I did and told her i didn't appreciate her sarcasm and that I was going to speak to her manger as she was an apprentice. She just looked at me with a smirk didn't say anything and i walked away. 

We asked for a crispy tortilla with our bowl as we do anytime we go into a Chipotle went through the line, payed and sat down to eat. The tortilla was not crispy at all so went over and asked for a crispy tortilla Briana's response was, "Oh we can burn it for you." She then turned around and yelled   "One burnt tortilla!" I told her I wasn't asking for a burnt tortilla and she instructed me to take a seat and she would let me know when it was ready. Then she yelled across the room that our burnt tortilla was ready. As she stood there in front of her register as oppose to walking over 6 feet from where we were. I'm glad she thought it was funny. I hope management realizes that Briana is not fit to be a leader she seemed more like a rude entitled 18 year old little girl. #neversettingfootthereagain

I work close by and order food from here very frequently. Every time I go here, something happens, either my food is wrong or the order that I placed an hour previously is not ready. You give the place your number so they can call you and let you know if there are any problems with your order. This time, I placed an order 45 minutes in advance, when I got there, my food was not ready and there was no white rice available for my order. They should have called me with the number they require me to put on file and let me know. Not the end of the world, but this is why you place orders in advance and give them your information.

"Oh my no!"  Is what I would say if someone were to ask me if they should eat at this Chipotle.  I came here and was hugely disappointed when all the meat I tried was dry, bland, and looked old.  When I mentioned to the line staff that the meat they're offering can only be compared to expired cat food, I was given a look as though I had no right to judge.  When I asked when will the items will be thrown away and replaced with freshly cooked meat, I was told it had to be sold first.  In the long history between Chipotle and I, I have never experienced such disregard for quality.  Shame!

I order a steak burrito with beans and rice and I got a rice and beans burrito with a bit of steak

Taste is good

Service is great

I agree with a lot of the recent reviews, service is lacking at this store.  Went in on a Monday night around 8pm.  First, the brown rice was not ready ... had to wait approx. 5 mins.  Second, they were completely out of pico de gallo.  So for $7.10, my bowl looked pretty skimpy.  I've noticed the amount served varies greatly from one Chipotle store to the next.  I will be skipping this store next time.

Chipotle is a true treat, I rarely eat here and was telling my boyfriend as we sat and ate why do we not come here more often? Seriously I have not eaten at Chipotle for at least 7 years and that was in los angeles when they first started opening locations. I enjoyed the build my own options, Subway style with creating exactly what I want. I opted for a beef burrito, it was a hard decision as the chicken looked so juicy and good as well. 

I was not in the mood for beans so I selected, cilantro rice, tender juicy beef, green peppers and onions, cheese, pico de gallo, sour cream, guacamole and lettuce. This burrito was fat even without the beans!

The first thing that comes to mind after the first bite is FRESH! The food is not greasy, every ingredient taste fresh and of good quality!

I also chose a side of guacamole and chips! Mmmmm yum I love their guacamole and fresh fried corn chips so much!

We will be back! I have been missing out and will not wait as long as I did to return!

Also for all of you soda and iced tea lovers it is serve yourself when you dine in for drinks so you can have all you want refills which is a bonus! I really liked their fresh brewed iced tea!



Mmmmmm yummy!

Like any other Chipotle location. Service was standard and there is plenty of parking and it's conveniently located.  

The toppings weren't the freshest I have encountered. They were heavy handed with the meat, toppings and salsas, which was a bonus.
